thread.title: Patrick Firman expects 'learning curve' in new role as Denver sheriff
thread.title_full: Patrick Firman expects 'learning curve' in new role as Denver sheriff - The Denver Post

author: Noelle Phillips
title: Patrick Firman expects 'learning curve' in new role as Denver sheriff
text:
Denver's new sheriff Patrick Firman will step into a different environment than the one in which he has spent his career in suburban Chicago.
However, Denver Mayor Michael Hancock and Firman said Thursday that he has the foundation needed to guide Denver's department through reform.
"There's always going to be a difference between facilities," Firman said. "I think the key, though, is there is a core aspect of running a correctional facility."
"I know there's going to be a learning curve for me because it's obviously different than what I've done before. But I think I've got the base and the background."
Hancock announced his hiring of Firman during a news conference in his office.
Firman's references reported Firman would be a change agent with integrity and someone who would be hard-working and inspire employees, Hancock said.
"This is the guy when we all got the report and read over it — and it was voluminous — I'm telling you we all thought this is the guy," Hancock said. "I'm proud not just that we selected him but for him to select Denver with all that we've been challenged with."
Firman will be sworn in at 10 a.m. Friday during a ceremony in the atrium of the Wellington Webb Municipal Office Building.
Advertisement Firman, who was a deputy chief of corrections in McHenry County (Ill.) from 2009 to 2014, steps into the embattled Denver department as officials work to implement reforms after a series of excessive force cases and other ongoing problems that have plagued Denver's jails.
Firman said he was well-aware of the issues facing the Denver Sheriff Department.
"I see it as a challenge, really," Firman said. "I see my role as coming in and continuing the process."
Firman, who spent the past year as a law enforcement consultant according to his LinkedIn page , oversaw the McHenry jail with hundreds of inmates and department staff and managed multi-million dollar budgets. McHenry County is northwest of Chicago.
Before moving to McHenry, Firman started his career and spent 19 years in the Lake County (Ill.) sheriff's department, moving from corrections officer to the chief of corrections. Lake County is north of Chicago.
DENVER, CO - OCTOBER 15: Patrick Firman was named the new sheriff for the City and County of Denver by Denver Mayor Michael Hancock on Thursday, October 15, 2015. (Photo by Cyrus McCrimmon/The Denver Post ) (THE DENVER POST | Cyrus McCrimmon) Firman was chosen after a national search that landed 25 applicants. Six were picked as finalists, Hancock said. Of those, Firman rose to the top of everyone on the selection committee's list.
"Leadership. That's number one," Hancock said. "He has the courage and the willingness to say, 'I will do it.' He knows this is a challenging situation."
Firman will earn a little more than $171,000 a year, said Amber Miller, the mayor's spokeswoman.
Denver has been searching for a new sheriff since July 2014 when Gary Wilson stepped down from the job and was replaced in the interim by Elias Diggins.
Hancock on Thursday thanked Diggins for his help during the search. Diggins and other top Denver deputies did not attend Thursday's news conference. Denver Police Chief Robert White and Fire Chief Eric Tade were there, along with Denver's director of safety Stephanie O'Malley.
Since Wilson left, Hillard Heintze of Chicago and OIR Group of Los Angeles, have reviewed the department and released a nearly 300-page report detailing deep problems.
This is a developing story that will be updated as more information becomes available.
